      • getPageCount

      • getItemsPerPage

        public int getItemsPerPage()
        Get the total number of items per page in this menu; this is simply nine times the amount of rows that were given in the constructor.
        Returns:
        The number of items per page.

      • setPage

        public boolean setPage(int page,
                       MenuItem[] set_to,
                       boolean overwrite)
        Set the given MenuItem[] to the given page, specifying whether to completely overwrite the page or not. The operation will fail if the given MenuItem[] is not of the appropriate length; use getItemsPerPage() to get this length.
        Parameters:
        page - The page to change.
        set_to - The MenuItem[] to use to make the change.
        overwrite - If false, existing items on the page will not be overwritten, only currently null items will be replaced with those from the given MenuItem[].
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • addPage

        public boolean addPage(MenuItem[] new_page)
        Add a new page and subsequently assign it items based on the given MenuItem[].
        Parameters:
        new_page - A MenuItem[] of an appropriate length for this PaginatedMenu; use getItemsPerPage() to find the appropriate length.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • addPage

        public void addPage()
        Add one page to this PaginatedMenu; the page will be initialized as empty.

      • addPages

        void addPages(int count)
        Add the given number of pages to this PaginatedMenu; the pages will be initialized as empty.

        count - The number of pages to add.
